media:group.media:title: Most common recycling mistakes
media:group.media:description:
Some items that may seem right for your recycling bin actually aren't, and it's doing more harm than you might realize. CNN's Allison Chinchar explains.
#ClimateCrisis #CNN #News

entry.title: What you can do to slow climate change

media:group.media:title: What you can do to slow climate change
media:group.media:description:
Here are a few things you can do to start making a difference in slowing down climate change.

entry.title: Hog farmer: I never imagined having to do this

media:group.media:title: Hog farmer: I never imagined having to do this
media:group.media:description: A Minnesota hog farm is gearing up for a traumatizing experience amid the closing of American pork plants during the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Gary Tuchman reports. #CNN #News

entry.title: This is who decides what fashion we will wear

media:group.media:title: This is who decides what fashion we will wear
media:group.media:description:
Who really decides what we wear? In his very own "The Devil Wears Prada" moment, fashion expert Colin McDowell explains the fashion chain of influence
#Fashion #CNN #News

entry.title: In reversal, Trump says task force will continue 'indefinitely'

media:group.media:title: In reversal, Trump says task force will continue 'indefinitely'
media:group.media:description: President Donald Trump declared his coronavirus task force would continue "indefinitely" a day after he and Vice President Mike Pence said they were phasing out the health-focused panel in favor of a group focused on reopening the economy. #CNN #News

entry.title: Economist makes dire prediction about US employment rate

media:group.media:title: Economist makes dire prediction about US employment rate
media:group.media:description:
Moody's Analytics chief economist Mark Zandi says that while jobs will come back as businesses start to reopen, the US will never get back to pre-pandemic unemployment rate as long as social distancing measures remain because of Covid-19.
#Economy #CNN #News

entry.title: SE Cupp: If Trump was a coworker, I'd fear for my safety

media:group.media:title: SE Cupp: If Trump was a coworker, I'd fear for my safety
media:group.media:description: CNN's SE Cupp talks to Tom Nichols, senior adviser to The Lincoln Project, about President Donald Trump's angry reaction to a new ad from the conservative group criticizing his response to the coronavirus pandemic. #CNN #News

entry.title: Woman jailed for defying lockdown. See what she told judge

media:group.media:title: Woman jailed for defying lockdown. See what she told judge
media:group.media:description:
Dallas salon owner Shelley Luther was sentenced to 7 days in jail after refusing to close her salon despite statewide stay-at-home orders.
#CNN #News

entry.title: See Trump's reaction when nurse says PPE is 'sporadic'

media:group.media:title: See Trump's reaction when nurse says PPE is 'sporadic'
media:group.media:description:
President Donald Trump contradicted a nurse he was honoring in the Oval Office on Wednesday, insisting there are no personal protective equipment shortages in the US despite her account that availability could be "sporadic."
A reporter asked the nurses attending the National Nurse Day event if their PPE supplies are where they need to be amid the coronavirus pandemic, and many of them nodded in agreement or answered affirmatively.
#Coronavirus #CNN #News

entry.title: Chris Cuomo jokes with his governor brother: You're single and ready to mingle

media:group.media:title: Chris Cuomo jokes with his governor brother: You're single and ready to mingle
media:group.media:description:
CNN's Chris Cuomo and brother Gov. Andrew Cuomo (D-NY) discuss federal funding and timetables of reopening states during the coronavirus pandemic. Chris also asks his brother about his recent appearance on "The Ellen Degeneres Show."
#CNN #News

entry.title: Study finds black communities account for disproportionate number of Covid-19 deaths in US

media:group.media:title: Study finds black communities account for disproportionate number of Covid-19 deaths in US
media:group.media:description:
There's new evidence more African Americans may be dying from coronavirus in the United States than whites or other ethnic groups, according to a new study. Black Americans represent 13.4% of the population, according to the US Census Bureau, but counties with higher black populations account for more than half of all Covid-19 cases and almost 60% of deaths, the study found.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Obama administration acting CDC director says 'we can't accept that as a society'

media:group.media:title: Obama administration acting CDC director says 'we can't accept that as a society'
media:group.media:description:
Former CDC director Dr. Richard Besser and CNN's Anderson Cooper discuss the economic effect that the coronavirus is having on some minority communities in the US.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Bill de Blasio: Trump is politicizing a pandemic

media:group.media:title: Bill de Blasio: Trump is politicizing a pandemic
media:group.media:description:
New York mayor Bill de Blasio tells CNN's John Berman that President Trump is politicizing the coronavirus pandemic by discussing 'red states' and 'blue states' when it comes to funding and stimulus money to help fight Covid-19.
#CNN #News

entry.title: Wife of slain security guard: Shooters can't take away his legacy

media:group.media:title: Wife of slain security guard: Shooters can't take away his legacy
media:group.media:description: Calvin Munerlyn was a 43-year-old security guard who officials say was shot dead after he told a customer at a Michigan Family Dollar to wear a state-mandated face mask. CNN's Don Lemon spoke with his wife Latryna Munerlyn about the kind-hearted man and devoted father of eight he was. #CNN #News
